occurrences.text: as high as it is here, if we've not prepared to stand, we're probably gonna bow. We're gonna justify it somehow in our minds. Everybody else is doing it. You probably said that as a teenager like I did. Why can't I do that, mom? Why can't I do that? That everybody else is doing it. I think I only said that a handful of times, honestly, because each time I said that, they said, okay, tell me who's doing it, and it was just like, mmm, everybody. But you understand. Notice what the wise man says, Solomon, Proverbs 24. Notice what he says in Proverbs 24 and verse number 10. What a great truth that God gives us here in this verse of Scripture. The Bible says in Proverbs 24 and verse number 10, if thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small. Can I tell you this morning that the day of adversity is gonna come? It's gonna come. It's not talking about physical strength, however. See, we wrestle not against flesh and blood, as I referenced in Ephesians 6 this morning by way of introduction. We wrestle against spiritual wickedness in high places. And here he's not speaking about our strength being small, meaning that our physical strength is small. Remember, Paul said, in my weakness, then I'm strong. Why? Because his strength is made perfect in weakness. And we find that
